Description: Upper body sherd (mended from five fragments) of Aeolian pottery large chalice; glaze fired red-brown; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired red); added red bands lined in white; top of rim glazed; exterior: chevron pattern at rim above dilute line; below, boar (head and one hind leg missing; pseudo black-figure details of bristles and trotters), to right; rosettes, dotted square and double-edged saw pattern as filling ornament; below, top of handle zone.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.31)
